content: Rust-analyzer has a 1-to-1 mapping between rowan trees and files/macro expansions AFAIK. It merges all files of a crate together at HIR level.
Ah okay, but how about cross-crate information?
(Oh and I forgot to mention, this is for a language I'm building which shares some similarity with Rust)
Rust-analyzer uses a single salsa database to store information for all crates.
Ah alright. So if I understand correctly, RA essentially loads everything required at once, then parses it all, rather than parsing each file when depended on?

Rust-analyzer puts the source files in the salsa database. Various queries can then lazily compute things lile the parsed syntax tree. Salsa ensures that queries are recalculated when their input changes.
Ahh kay, I shall look into salsa then, thanks!
